sections.section_instructions:
Do the following statements agree with the information given in Reading Passage?

In boxes 15-21 on your answer sheet, write:

TRUE. if the statement agrees with the information
FALSE. if the statement contradicts the information
NOT GIVEN. If there is no information on this

questions.question_text: Artists in the German aesthetic tradition portrayed nature realistically.
Margaret attended a famous art college in Paris.
Margaret met her husband William while teaching a craft at a rehabilitation unit.
Margaret Preston and Thea Proctor explored similar themes in their art.
Margaret's 1925 artworks of Sydney Harbour were simpler than her previous ones.
The colours in Margaret's Berowra prints were very bright.
When living in Berowra, Margaret painted flowers in their natural location.

sections.section_instructions:
Complete the notes below.

Choose ONE WORD AND/OR A NUMBER from the passage for each answer.

Write your answers in boxes 22-27 on your answer sheet.

content.paragraph:
Margaret Preston's later life

Aboriginal influence
• Interest in Aboriginal art was inspired by seeing rock engravings close to her Berowra home.
• Incorporated {22} and colours from Aboriginal art in her own work often.
• Referred to Aboriginal sources in the {23} she gave her artworks.

1953 exhibition
• Very old method of {24} was used for some prints.
• Was inspired by {25} about Chinese art that she had started collecting in 1915.
• Combination of Chinese and Aboriginal elements.

Old age
• Still interested in {26} and art.
• Worked for nearly six decades making more than {27} artworks.
• Dedicated to Australian art and the originality of her work is seen in Preston's long career.
